The protagonist, Frank, is a psychopathic teenager living on a remote Scottish island who has committed heinous acts, including killing three children before the age of ten. The novel was a success and led Banks to pursue full-time writing. It was also listed as one of the top 100 books of the 20th century in a poll of over 25,000 readers of "The Independent."
